issue.title: PX4/rotors SITL support requires sensor level data

content.raw: Right,  we handle the frame conversion in the gazebo mavlink currently.  I'm currently leaning towards the mavlink approach. Mavlink is a stable protocol and it will maintain backwards compatibility with new updates. If I compile px4 against a specific gazebo version it won't be as flexible. I would also like the ability to specify the autopilot binary in the sdf and have gazebo handle everything. My question there is how to give the user terminal access to the shell easily and make it cross platform. Boost seems to have a process library
